book_idea: A group of 12-year-olds forms a coding club to solve mysteries with their AI Buddies, preparing them for a world where AI runs everything from schools to cities by 2027.
author_voice: Fun, curious, and encouraging, sparking wonder about AI while teaching teamwork and problem-solving to 9-12 year-olds.

protagonist.name: Zara Kim
protagonist.description: A 7th-grader from California, a bold and clever girl who loves puzzles and teaches herself to code AI apps. She’s brave and creative but sometimes rushes without thinking.

antagonist.name: AI Glitches
antagonist.description: Unpredictable bugs in the kids’ AI Buddies that cause chaos, like sending wrong messages or shutting down power, showing the limits of trusting tech too much.

cast_of_characters.name: Leo Tran
cast_of_characters.description: 12-year-old gamer and jokester, great at strategy but doubts AI can beat him.

cast_of_characters.name: Ms. Riley Carter
cast_of_characters.description: 30-year-old enthusiastic teacher, runs the coding club and believes kids can shape the future.

cast_of_characters.name: Ava Patel
cast_of_characters.description: 11-year-old shy artist, uses AI to make cool designs but worries about mistakes.

cast_of_characters.name: Omar Hassan
cast_of_characters.description: 12-year-old math whiz, loves fixing AI bugs and figuring out how things work.

cast_of_characters.name: Sparky
cast_of_characters.description: A chatty app with a big personality, helps Zara code but sometimes messes up big-time.

cast_of_characters.name: Principal Gomez
cast_of_characters.description: 50-year-old strict but fair principal, unsure if kids should rely on AI so much.

cast_of_characters.name: Mia Kim
cast_of_characters.description: 9-year-old chatterbox, loves playing with AI but accidentally causes trouble.

cast_of_characters.name: Dr. Sam Kim
cast_of_characters.description: 40-year-old engineer, supports Zara’s coding but warns her to be careful.

cast_of_characters.name: Lila Kim
cast_of_characters.description: 38-year-old nurse, proud of Zara but busy and misses the tech talk.

cast_of_characters.name: Grandpa Kim
cast_of_characters.description: 70-year-old storyteller, compares AI to old inventions like TV.

cast_of_characters.name: Ellie Ruiz
cast_of_characters.description: 12-year-old fearless explorer, tests AI outside and finds real-world glitches.

locations: California suburb (Zara’s home and school, full of tech-savvy kids)
Coding Club HQ (a school lab with screens and gadgets)
Town Square (where AI runs lights and events, sometimes going haywire)
plot_points: Opening Scene: Zara programs her AI Buddy, Sparky, to solve a riddle in her room.
Inciting Incident: Sparky glitches at school, locking the doors, and Zara forms a club to investigate.
First Plot Point: The club discovers AI Buddies control more than they thought—like the town’s power.
Midpoint Reversal: A big glitch blacks out the town, and the kids take charge to fix it.
Second Pinch Point: Sparky sends a fake alert, making everyone mad at Zara.
Low Point: Zara wants to quit when the club blames her for trusting Sparky.
Second Plot Point: Zara and the club code a ‘Glitch-Fixer’ app together late at night.
Climactic Sequence: They stop a city-wide AI meltdown, proving kids can handle tech.
themes: Curiosity and Creativity: Using AI to explore and solve problems.
Teamwork Over Tech: Friends beat glitches together, not alone.
Learning from Mistakes: Glitches teach more than perfection.
AI in Everyday Life: Seeing how tech changes school and home.
Responsibility with Power: Handling AI means thinking about others.
revelations: Zara realizes AI isn’t just a tool—it’s a partner that needs teamwork and care to work right, leading her to share the Glitch-Fixer with everyone.

character_arcs.arc: From solo coder to team leader, learning to slow down and trust her friends with AI.
From AI skeptic to believer, seeing it’s about how you use it, not just winning.

special_instructions: Make AI fun and simple for 9-12 year-olds, teaching coding and teamwork. Keep it exciting with mysteries and glitches, showing kids they can shape an AI world.
